title: What grade level is an associate's degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A. What grade level is an associate's degree? If you believe that a bachelor’s degree is grade 16, then an associate’s degree is 14; however, no one in the US uses grades to identified college years. They use freshman, sophomore, junior, and senior based on the number of credit hours/units. An associate’s degree is 60 credit hours/units where a bachelor’s degree is 120 credit hours/units. Public schools that are paid by taxpayers. They are identified by preK-12, prekindergarten to a senior year in high school. If public schools include associate’s degrees are paid by taxpayers, the designation would be preK-14; similarly, if public schools include bachelor’s degrees, the designation would be preK-16. However, even this designation does not change the freshman, sophomore, junior and senior for college years.

You could have googled this or talked to your guidance counsellor to get this information. It would be faster and much more accurate than asking on Quora. From Google: Geteducated.com An associate’s degree is a two-year post-secondary degree. Students who pursue this kind of degree full-time can complete a program in as little as two years— though many choose to go at their own pace. An associate degree translates into the first two years of a bachelor’s degree (freshman and sophomore years). Associate’s degrees have been popular for the last twenty years. Increasingly, people are turning to associate’s as a quicker, less expensive route to career change than the traditional bachelor’s or four-year degree. Some occupations require workers to have a least “some college” in their educational background, in which case, an associate degree is a perfect fit. Other employers simply require employees to have an associate degree and have it listed as an essential job qualification.
